Eni Gas & Power

LayoutNode.Content: Eni S.p.A. is an Italian multinational oil and gas company headquartered in Rome. It has operations in 79 countries, and is currently Italy's largest industrial company with a market capitalization of 68 billion euros (US$ 90 billion), as of August 14, 2013. The Italian government owns a 30.3% golden share in the company, 3.93% held through the state Treasury and 26.37% held through the Cassa depositi e prestiti. Another 39.40% of the shares are held by BNP Paribas.
LayoutNode.SRC: Eni S.p.A. is an Italian multinational oil and gas company headquartered in Rome. It has operations in 79 countries, and is currently Italy's largest industrial company with a market capitalization of 68 billion euros (US$ 90 billion), as of August 14, 2013. The Italian government owns a 30.3% golden share in the company, 3.93% held through the state Treasury and 26.37% held through the Cassa depositi e prestiti. Another 39.40% of the shares are held by BNP Paribas.

LayoutNode.Content: The name "ENI" was initially the acronym of "Ente Nazionale Idrocarburi" (national hydrocarbons authority). Through the years after its foundation however, it operated in a large number of fields including contracting, nuclear power, energy, mining, chemicals and plastics, refining/extraction and distribution machinery, hospitality industry and even textile industry and news.
LayoutNode.SRC: The name "ENI" was initially the acronym of "Ente Nazionale Idrocarburi" (national hydrocarbons authority). Through the years after its foundation however, it operated in a large number of fields including contracting, nuclear power, energy, mining, chemicals and plastics, refining/extraction and distribution machinery, hospitality industry and even textile industry and news.

LayoutNode.Content: Eni was founded and established by law in 1953 from an existing company, Agip, created in 1926 with the aim to explore for oilfields, acquire and commercialize oil and derivatives. On March 1953 Enrico Mattei was nominated Eni’s Chairman.
LayoutNode.SRC: Eni was founded and established by law in 1953 from an existing company, Agip, created in 1926 with the aim to explore for oilfields, acquire and commercialize oil and derivatives. On March 1953 Enrico Mattei was nominated Eni’s Chairman.

LayoutNode.Content: Eni originally was an acronym for the company's full title Ente Nazionale Idrocarburi. Since 1995 the meaning ceased to be relevant but the name was maintained.
LayoutNode.SRC: Eni originally was an acronym for the company's full title Ente Nazionale Idrocarburi. Since 1995 the meaning ceased to be relevant but the name was maintained.

LayoutNode.Content: In 1952 Eni chooses its own logo, the six-legged dog, an imaginary animal symbolizing the sum of a car’s four wheels and the two legs of its driver.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 1952 Eni chooses its own logo, the six-legged dog, an imaginary animal symbolizing the sum of a car’s four wheels and the two legs of its driver.

LayoutNode.Content: Starting 1954 Eni holds extensive exploration rights in North Africa, signing an agreement with the Egyptian government lead by Nasser while providing an active and equal role for the crude producing countries through the establishment of joint ventures.
LayoutNode.SRC: Starting 1954 Eni holds extensive exploration rights in North Africa, signing an agreement with the Egyptian government lead by Nasser while providing an active and equal role for the crude producing countries through the establishment of joint ventures.

LayoutNode.Content: In 1957 Eni pushed for a similar agreement, known as the “Mattei formula”, to be signed with Persian Shah Reza Pahlavi and the National Iranian Company.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 1957 Eni pushed for a similar agreement, known as the “Mattei formula”, to be signed with Persian Shah Reza Pahlavi and the National Iranian Company.

LayoutNode.Content: In 1960, during the Cold War period, Eni signed an agreement with the Soviet Union for the importation of Russian crude at very reasonable prices.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 1960, during the Cold War period, Eni signed an agreement with the Soviet Union for the importation of Russian crude at very reasonable prices.

LayoutNode.Content: On 27 October 1962 Enrico Mattei died on an aircraft accident involving his twin-jet while surrounding Bascapè, on his way to Milan from Catania.
LayoutNode.SRC: On 27 October 1962 Enrico Mattei died on an aircraft accident involving his twin-jet while surrounding Bascapè, on his way to Milan from Catania.

LayoutNode.Content: During the following years, Eni signed contracts in joint venture with foreign companies to supply crude from Egypt to Iran and from Libya to Tunisia.
LayoutNode.SRC: During the following years, Eni signed contracts in joint venture with foreign companies to supply crude from Egypt to Iran and from Libya to Tunisia.
In 1967 Eni acquired Italgas.

LayoutNode.Content: In October 1973 after the Yom Kippur War and the embargo against the United States and the Netherlands agreed by OPEC members Arab countries, a serious oil crisis occurred, pushing Eni in need to consolidate its position in the international market by signing an agreement with Sonatrach, the Algerian state oil entity for natural gas supply.
LayoutNode.SRC: In October 1973 after the Yom Kippur War and the embargo against the United States and the Netherlands agreed by OPEC members Arab countries, a serious oil crisis occurred, pushing Eni in need to consolidate its position in the international market by signing an agreement with Sonatrach, the Algerian state oil entity for natural gas supply.

LayoutNode.Content: In 1974 Eni signed an agreement with Libyan government, followed by further agreements with Egypt, Nigeria and Tunisia, while developing two new major oil discoveries in the British North Sea got on 1972.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 1974 Eni signed an agreement with Libyan government, followed by further agreements with Egypt, Nigeria and Tunisia, while developing two new major oil discoveries in the British North Sea got on 1972.

LayoutNode.Content: During the middle 70’s Eni planned a major infrastructure for transporting natural gas over long distances by building a pipeline network of thousands of miles throughout Europe and the Mediterranean.
LayoutNode.SRC: During the middle 70’s Eni planned a major infrastructure for transporting natural gas over long distances by building a pipeline network of thousands of miles throughout Europe and the Mediterranean.

LayoutNode.Content: After the inauguration of the Trans-Mediterranean Pipeline connecting Algeria to Sicily through Tunisia, Eni signs a new agreement with Libya for the exploitation of Boùri, the biggest oilfield in the centre of the Mediterranean, and develops its international role within the oil industry.
LayoutNode.SRC: After the inauguration of the Trans-Mediterranean Pipeline connecting Algeria to Sicily through Tunisia, Eni signs a new agreement with Libya for the exploitation of Boùri, the biggest oilfield in the centre of the Mediterranean, and develops its international role within the oil industry.

LayoutNode.Content: In 1992 Eni became a joint stock company by Law Decree, being listed to the Italian and New York Stock Exchange in 1995.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 1992 Eni became a joint stock company by Law Decree, being listed to the Italian and New York Stock Exchange in 1995.

LayoutNode.Content: From 1995 to 1998 Eni put four share offers fully successfully, as 70% of its capital assets were sold to private shareholders.
LayoutNode.SRC: From 1995 to 1998 Eni put four share offers fully successfully, as 70% of its capital assets were sold to private shareholders.

LayoutNode.Content: As the price of oil collapsed in 1998 as other major companies Eni got to turn into a race through merges, international acquisitions, new explorations and the foundation of real super-companies.
LayoutNode.SRC: As the price of oil collapsed in 1998 as other major companies Eni got to turn into a race through merges, international acquisitions, new explorations and the foundation of real super-companies.

LayoutNode.Content: Since 2000 Eni starts developing the major Kashagan oilfield offshore discovery, along the Caspian Sea.
LayoutNode.SRC: Since 2000 Eni starts developing the major Kashagan oilfield offshore discovery, along the Caspian Sea.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2005 the Blue Stream pipeline projected for gas supplying from southern Russia to Turkey is inaugurated as a joint venture between Eni and Gazprom.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2005 the Blue Stream pipeline projected for gas supplying from southern Russia to Turkey is inaugurated as a joint venture between Eni and Gazprom.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2007 Eni signs an agreement on South Stream feasibility study with Gazprom to import Russian gas to Europe across the Black Sea.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2007 Eni signs an agreement on South Stream feasibility study with Gazprom to import Russian gas to Europe across the Black Sea.

LayoutNode.Content: Activist asset manager Knight Vinke, which owns 1% of the outstanding shares of the company, in October 2009 has begun pressing Eni's management to operate a spin off of Eni's gas activities. In its opinion this would solve the undervaluation of the company and release up to 50 billion euros ($70bn) of hidden value.
LayoutNode.SRC: Activist asset manager Knight Vinke, which owns 1% of the outstanding shares of the company, in October 2009 has begun pressing Eni's management to operate a spin off of Eni's gas activities. In its opinion this would solve the undervaluation of the company and release up to 50 billion euros ($70bn) of hidden value.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2010 Eni achieves key production milestone in Iraqi Zubair oil field.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2010 Eni achieves key production milestone in Iraqi Zubair oil field.

LayoutNode.Content: After getting a licence in 2006 for the exploration of an offshore area in the north of Mozambique, known as Area 4, Eni announced several major natural gas discoveries between 2011 and 2012 such as Mamba South, Mamba North, Mamba North East, Coral 1.
LayoutNode.SRC: After getting a licence in 2006 for the exploration of an offshore area in the north of Mozambique, known as Area 4, Eni announced several major natural gas discoveries between 2011 and 2012 such as Mamba South, Mamba North, Mamba North East, Coral 1.

LayoutNode.Content: In February 2014, ENI discovered oil at its DRC offshore block.
LayoutNode.SRC: In February 2014, ENI discovered oil at its DRC offshore block.

LayoutNode.Content: As exploration and reserve replacement being major drivers for the company, Eni boosts for production additions in its core oil field areas (North and Sub-Saharan Africa, Venezuela, Barents Sea, Yamal Peninsula, Kazakhstan, Iraq and the Far East). Eni has about 130 exploration and production subsidiaries, such as Eni Norge.
LayoutNode.SRC: As exploration and reserve replacement being major drivers for the company, Eni boosts for production additions in its core oil field areas (North and Sub-Saharan Africa, Venezuela, Barents Sea, Yamal Peninsula, Kazakhstan, Iraq and the Far East). Eni has about 130 exploration and production subsidiaries, such as Eni Norge.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2012 Eni reported liquids and gas production for the full year of 1,701 kboe/d, this being calculated assuming a natural gas conversion factor to barrel equivalent, updated to 5,492 cubic feet of gas equal 1 barrel of oil from July 1, 2012.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2012 Eni reported liquids and gas production for the full year of 1,701 kboe/d, this being calculated assuming a natural gas conversion factor to barrel equivalent, updated to 5,492 cubic feet of gas equal 1 barrel of oil from July 1, 2012.

LayoutNode.Content: During 2012 60 new exploratory wells were drilled, as 56 were drilled in 2011 and 47 in 2010. The overall commercial success rate was 40% (40.8% net to Eni) as compared to 42% in 2011 (38.6% net to Eni) and 41% in 2010 (39% net to Eni). In 2012 351 development wells were drilled as well, as 407 in 2011 and 399 in 2010.
LayoutNode.SRC: During 2012 60 new exploratory wells were drilled, as 56 were drilled in 2011 and 47 in 2010. The overall commercial success rate was 40% (40.8% net to Eni) as compared to 42% in 2011 (38.6% net to Eni) and 41% in 2010 (39% net to Eni). In 2012 351 development wells were drilled as well, as 407 in 2011 and 399 in 2010.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2012, sales of natural gas were 95.32 bcm, down 1.44 bcm compared to 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2012, sales of natural gas were 95.32 bcm, down 1.44 bcm compared to 2011.

LayoutNode.SRC: Eni's electricity generation sites in Italy, as of January 2010, are the following:

LayoutNode.SRC: Austria France Germany Italy Czech Republic Romania Slovakia Slovenia Switzerland Hungary

LayoutNode.Content: Eni operates in engineering, construction and drilling both offshore and onshore for the oil&gas industry through the subsidiary Saipem.
LayoutNode.SRC: Eni operates in engineering, construction and drilling both offshore and onshore for the oil&gas industry through the subsidiary Saipem.

LayoutNode.Content: In April 2012, Eni in collaboration with ZEiTECS announced the world's first offshore rigless/wireline retrievable ESP system for Eni Congo.
LayoutNode.SRC: In April 2012, Eni in collaboration with ZEiTECS announced the world's first offshore rigless/wireline retrievable ESP system for Eni Congo.

LayoutNode.Content: Eni Gas & Power (100% owned) - a natural gas and power company based in Belgium formed by merger of Distrigas and Nuon Belgium
LayoutNode.SRC: • Eni Gas & Power (100% owned) - a natural gas and power company based in Belgium formed by merger of Distrigas and Nuon Belgium

LayoutNode.Content: versalis (100% owned) - Versalis is a chemical company that manages the production and marketing of petrochemical products such as olefines, aromatics and intermediates (base chemicals), styrenes, elastomers and polyethylene, plus in recent years a focus on green chemistry, being also able to count on a range of proprietary technologies, advanced plant facilities and a broad-based distribution network.
LayoutNode.SRC: • versalis (100% owned) - Versalis is a chemical company that manages the production and marketing of petrochemical products such as olefines, aromatics and intermediates (base chemicals), styrenes, elastomers and polyethylene, plus in recent years a focus on green chemistry, being also able to count on a range of proprietary technologies, advanced plant facilities and a broad-based distribution network.

LayoutNode.Content: Saipem (43% owned) - Saipem is an oil and gas industry contractor. Saipem has contracted for engineering, oilfield services and construction both offshore and onshore through several pipelines, including Blue Stream, Greenstream, Nord Stream and South Stream. It is a subsidiary listed on the Italian Stock Exchange.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Saipem (43% owned) - Saipem is an oil and gas industry contractor. Saipem has contracted for engineering, oilfield services and construction both offshore and onshore through several pipelines, including Blue Stream, Greenstream, Nord Stream and South Stream. It is a subsidiary listed on the Italian Stock Exchange.

LayoutNode.Content: Eni UK - carries out operations in the British section of the North Sea, in the Irish Sea and off the coast of the Shetland Islands. Has been present in UK since 1964. In 2006 Eni UK's average net production of hydrocarbons was more than 141,000 boe/d.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Eni UK - carries out operations in the British section of the North Sea, in the Irish Sea and off the coast of the Shetland Islands. Has been present in UK since 1964. In 2006 Eni UK's average net production of hydrocarbons was more than 141,000 boe/d.

LayoutNode.Content: Eni India is expected to start drilling at a deepwater block 2, near Andaman and Nicobar Islands in Q2 of 2011 as it has received 2 year extension for the completion of drilling program. The program was delayed due to various environmental issues and scarcity of oil rigs. ENI India had won this block in 2005 and partners with ONGC and GAIL India.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Eni India is expected to start drilling at a deepwater block 2, near Andaman and Nicobar Islands in Q2 of 2011 as it has received 2 year extension for the completion of drilling program. The program was delayed due to various environmental issues and scarcity of oil rigs. ENI India had won this block in 2005 and partners with ONGC and GAIL India.

LayoutNode.Content: The Central Energy Italian Gas Holding scandal in 2005 involved Eni and Gazprom
LayoutNode.SRC: The Central Energy Italian Gas Holding scandal in 2005 involved Eni and Gazprom

LayoutNode.Content: In 2009, the European Commission filed formal antitrust charges against Eni. The commission believes that Eni has conspired to keep competitors from using its gas pipelines.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2009, the European Commission filed formal antitrust charges against Eni. The commission believes that Eni has conspired to keep competitors from using its gas pipelines.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2009 again, according to the WikiLeaks cables, US ambassador Lanier told Washington that bribery allegations were made in Uganda by Eni which at the time was in competition for oil assets in the country against Tullow Oil. The bribes were taken by the newly appointed Ugandan prime minister, Amama Mbabazi.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2009 again, according to the WikiLeaks cables, US ambassador Lanier told Washington that bribery allegations were made in Uganda by Eni which at the time was in competition for oil assets in the country against Tullow Oil. The bribes were taken by the newly appointed Ugandan prime minister, Amama Mbabazi.

LayoutNode.Content: After corruption charges around the subsidiary Saipem, Eni's CFO Alessandro Berninihad to resign and the new CFO Massimo Mondazzi took over in December 2012.
LayoutNode.SRC: After corruption charges around the subsidiary Saipem, Eni's CFO Alessandro Berninihad to resign and the new CFO Massimo Mondazzi took over in December 2012.

LayoutNode.Content: Eni has been included into the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index since 2007.
LayoutNode.SRC: Eni has been included into the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index since 2007.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2012 Eni is confirmed on the FTSE4Good Index for the sixth consecutive year.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2012 Eni is confirmed on the FTSE4Good Index for the sixth consecutive year.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2012 Eni is also included in the Carbon Performance Leadership Index and is the only FTSE MIB company to gain the triple E for Standard Ethics.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2012 Eni is also included in the Carbon Performance Leadership Index and is the only FTSE MIB company to gain the triple E for Standard Ethics.

LayoutNode.Content: During 2012 Eni got a 10% down in CO2eq emissions from flaring per produced toe compared to 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: During 2012 Eni got a 10% down in CO2eq emissions from flaring per produced toe compared to 2011.
